articles.description: England end Euro 2024 qualifying campaign with 1-1 draw in North Macedonia, Northern Ireland defeat Denmark and Italy qualify with draw against Ukraine.
articles.title: Euros reaction - England held, NI win, Italy qualify

articles.description: Arsenal forward Beth Mead is back in Sarina Wiegman's England squad for the first time in over a year after recovering from an ACL injury.
articles.title: Mead returns to England squad after year out

articles.description: Minnows San Marino score against Finland to record goals in three consecutive matches for the first time.
articles.title: San Marino score in third straight match for first time

articles.description: France captain Antoine Dupont will make the "perfect sevens player", says England scrum-half Danny Care.
articles.title: France star Dupont will be 'perfect sevens player'

articles.description: The Football Association says it is "working to find a resolution" after a transgender player stopped playing football when rival clubs refused to play against her.
articles.title: FA looking for resolution over trans player dispute

articles.description: Watch live coverage as Scotland's women take on Germany before they meet Switzerland in the European Curling Championships.
articles.title: Watch: Scotland women v Germany

articles.description: The family of Siobhan Cattigan say they "cannot begin to grieve" until questions surrounding the former Scotland forward's death are answered.
articles.title: Cattigan family 'cannot grieve' as they seek answers

articles.description: Group C winners England get the point they needed to secure a top seeding at Euro 2024 with an unconvincing draw away to North Macedonia.
articles.title: England unconvincing in draw at North Macedonia

articles.description: Manager Gareth Southgate praises England's "excellent" mentality after they come from behind to draw in North Macedonia in their final Euro 2024 qualifier.
articles.title: 'Excellent' England mentality pleases Southgate

articles.description: United States defender Sergino Dest apologises for being sent off in the 2-1 defeat by Trinidad and Tobago after criticism from his team-mates and head coach.
articles.title: USA's Dest apologises for red card after criticism
